TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Cryogenic Engines: Liquid Hydrogen and Methane Rockets! (Jan 22, 2022)

Articles.Content: Thank,s bro)

Hello,

I loaded an old ship and i got an error with the Ct65 'Yucatan' Cryogenic Rocket Engine. I can't find it anymore. Has it been deleted/replaced ?

Thank you

Without paying too much attention to details, I installed this new update. I also installed cryo restock without thinking much of it, except kind of wondering "Hmm, I don't remember any stock cryo engines. I wonder what this does."

Then I launched a previously saved ship design, and "oops!", the Skipper engine on the middle stage has turned into a hydrogen engine. "Oh, so that's what cryo restock was..."

Revert to <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>.
hey how do I get these engines to burn liquid hydrogen instead of liquid fuel and how do I get methalox

Last version is not detecded by <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, chateaudav said:
> 
> 
> Last version is not detecded by <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
> 

As was correctly surmised on the previous page, this is because <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> pulls CryoEngines from Spacedock and version 1.0.2 does not appear to be there.
Ok thanks. I was not sure. =)

I resolved the issue, looks like SpaceDock had a bit of downtime when I released the update.

It has been hidden and is invisible by default in the editor. It can still be found though and will not affect any ships in flight.

I have question. is "cradle" truss from which fuel tank can be ejected, visible on this screen part of this mod?

![7PzCKm7.png](https://i.imgur.com/7PzCKm7.png)

Unfortunetly i cannot check right now myself.

It’s  Near Future Construction. It has those trusses, along with other kinds of truss. I’m pretty sure that those are tweakscaled down to fit with the SSPXR habitat, but I could be wrong.

And regular payload bays are too heavy, no need for fully enclosed space.

I've never updated to 1.7.x due to issues with other mods. Are there any other users of Cryoengines 1.0.2 (built against 1.7) out there still using 1.6.1? How's the mod treating you?

> 3 hours ago, Capt. Hunt said:
> 
> 
> Scatterer and planetshine help, but I think that's an artist's rendition, not a screenshot of anything in KSP.
> 

The picture is 100% KSP. Those are clearly CryoTanks, SSPXr, Near Future Construction, Near Future Solar and ReStock parts. The main reason it looks so much better than a regular Scaterrer and Planetshine install is KS3P with a custom config and a custom Kopernicus sunlight boost for more contrast. The way Orbital Phoenix does this is in the link posted by Friznit above.

Yes KSP can look this good if you put in a bit of effort!

This is my own recreation of a Copernicus mission following Orbital's settings for KS3P. Maybe not quite as nice as Orbitals screens but its not difficult to achieve this look if you follow his instructions.

[![bz9vU5Nh.png](http://i.imgur.com/bz9vU5Nh.png)](https://imgur.com/bz9vU5N)

[![5jjofFPh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/5jjofFPh.jpg)](https://imgur.com/5jjofFP)
